Black Dog Pub Co. - The Black Dog Pub Company 0 Skip to Content Black Dog Pub Co. Home The Black Dog Say Hello Open Menu Close Menu Black Dog Pub Co. Home The Black Dog Say Hello Open Menu Close Menu Home The Black Dog Say Hello The Black Dog Pub Company was founded by Paul Graham in 2013. The independent group owns and runs four venues in London: The Mayflower Pub in Rotherhithe, The Prince of Wales Pub in Kennington, the George & Dragon, Thames Ditton and The Three Stags Pub in Kennington. With so many pubs across the capital at threat from property developers, Paul and his team are committed to protecting the heritage of some of London’s oldest independent pubs. Since 2001, London has lost an average of 81 pubs a year, and with that the social and cultural value they bring. By preserving the characteristics and rich history of these old pubs, the Black Dog Pub Company is ensuring some of London’s most unique pubs can continue to be enjoyed by their local communities and visitors from around the world. The company name is inspired by Ringo, Paul’s gorgeous black haired Airedoodle. When he’s not posing for social media photos for fans you can find Ringo hanging out with our locals or making mischief in the local park with his friends and Mayflower regulars “The Salty Seadogs”. The Mayflower, Rotherhithe Having taken over The Mayflower in 2010, Paul and his team have turned the much loved local into one of London’s best pubs. A traditional English pub surrounded by cobbled streets, The Mayflower is a hidden gem in the heart of Rotherhithe. The outside decked jetty and cosy candlelit restaurant have stunning river views and you can spot the original 1620 mooring point of the Pilgrim Father’s Mayflower ship, warm yourself by the open fire and imagine who may have been sitting in your seat 400 years ago! The Mayflower kitchen offers consistently delicious food and people return again and again. Visit The Mayflower website here . The Prince of Wales, Kennington The Black Dog Pub Company took over The Prince of Wales in 2019, giving this long-established local pub a beautiful interior renovation and with a new chef at the helm we’ve overhauled the food, beer and wine served. With a small seating area outside, you can relax with a first-class pint or a glass of wine. Visit The Prince of Wales website here . George&Dragon, Thames Ditton A much loved local in the heart of Thames Ditton and tucked away off the high street, the George & Dragon is a wonderful traditional English pub with a large, open garden space, perfect for summer evenings. The venue has just undergone a beautiful interior renovation which is both welcoming, comfortable and cosy with some wonderful eclectic artwork. Three open fires make it a cosy place to enjoy the company of fabulous food and drink. The menu has been revamped and offers delicious, classic home cooked British dishes using local and fresh ingredients and is complemented by a great range of well-kept traditional ales, craft beers, local gins and fine wines. There is a large outside space which is beautifully lit and has heated lamps for those cooler evenings. Live sport is shown on various screens both inside and out. Visit the George & Dragon website here. The Three Stags Pub, Kennington The Black Dog Pub Company took over The Three Stags in 2023. Built in 1891 the pub sits opposite the Imperial War Museum in Kennington and is an excellent example of an old London pub with many original features. It boasts a Chaplin’s Corner where the famous Charlie Chaplins father used to drink and where Charlie saw his dad for the very last time. Enclosed with dark wood and frosted windows it makes for a great space for a private drink and dine. The Three Stags serves a fabulous All Day Menu, Craft Beers & Sundays Roasts plus there’s also a private room on the first floor available for dining and events. Visit the Three Stags Website website here . With over 30 years experience in the hospitality industry in the UK, Australia and New Zealand, Paul is passionate about finding unique pubs and restaurants in London and working with his team to bring out the individuality of each space. Whether that’s enjoying a pint at The Prince of Wales while watching a petanque match unfold in the beautiful Georgian square, or a roast dinner by candlelight at The Mayflower on a Sunday, our team are committed to making sure your experience of our pubs is like none other in London. We’re really proud that most of our team, from Pub Managers and bar staff to Head Chefs and sous chefs, have been with us since we launched in 2010. We know the difference this sense of family makes to our staff, our regulars and to our guests and we encourage any new faces in our venues to ask us about the history of our pubs from our knowledgeable team. If you have an enquiry about any of our venues or would like to discover more about The Black Dog Pub Company please email us here . Thank-you The Black Dog Pub Company 117 Rotherhithe Street Rotherhithe London SE16 4NF E: hello@blackdogpubcompany.co.uk The Mayflower Pub 117 Rotherhithe Street Rotherhithe London SE16 4NF T: 020 7237 4088 E: mayflowerrotherhithe@gmail.com The Prince of Wales Cleaver Square Kennington, London, SE11 4EA T: 0207 735 9916 E: hello@princeofwaleskennington.co.uk The George & Dragon High Street, Thames Ditton, Surrey, KT7 0RY E: hello@thegeorgeanddragonpub.com Three Stags Pub 67-69 Kennington Rd London, SE1 7PZ T: 020 7928 5974 E: bookings@threestagspub.com

All News Inspiring Animals Pub Owner Adopts Dog After it Dashed into Bar When Owner Died in Car Crash–Now He’s a Local Favorite By Good News Network - Jan 25, 2025 Shih Tzu dog named Rex adopts English pub as new home –SWNS An adorable dog was adopted by a kind-hearted pub manager after the pooch’s owner died in a car crash. The two-year-old Shih Tzu named Rex dashed into the busy bar after surviving the tragic car accident. Regulars at The Leaping Wolf in Wolverhampton, England, were left startled when the lost pooch ran into the pub during a football match. Manager Dan Morris caught the runaway pup and took him to the veterinarian to see if he was OK and inquire about where he could have come from. But, Dan was shocked to learn that Rex’s owner had passed away. That’s how the frisky pup came to be a new regular at the pub—and a real hit with locals. “It was last year’s Liverpool versus Wolves match, it was crammed inside and outside the bar,” said the 33-year-old barkeep. “Everyone said there was a dog running around and we had no idea where he came from.” Dan Morris with Shih Tzu dog adopted by his pub – SWNS “He has been great, all the customers love him and they even buy him presents. “He loves attention, he loves treats… He’s so spoiled: if we have takeaway, he has takeaway, if we have roast dinner he has roast dinner. “When we first took him, there was a period where it was difficult. When you’re trying to run a business and a new dog is running around the place it can be tough. But now he just likes to sit down and chill—its like he’s found his home now. “He’s well trained and we’re so thrilled to have him with us.” He also now acts ‘like a bouncer’ for The Leaping Wolf with his uncanny ability to sniff out troublemakers. He’s been known to bark at visitors who tend to be the ones that end up causing trouble in the pub. Shih Tzu Rex at The Leaping Wolf pub, his new home – SWNS “He sits and waits for people to come in and inspects them. We don’t know how he knows which guests are up to no good, but he’s usually right,” Dan told SWNS news. ANOTHER HAPPY ENDING : Saddest Dog in Town Spent Over 2 Years at a Shelter But Finally Gets a Home for Christmas “He’s a really well behaved dog—but I think he needs a girlfriend.” PUT A SMILE ON SOMEONE’S FACE: Share the Pub Dog’s Good Fortune On Social Media… Want A Morning Jolt of Good News? Submit The Love Your Pub Group & its subsidiaries are a trading name of Hardys Consultancy Ltd Units 1-2 Warrior Court, 9-11 Mumby Road, Gosport, Hampshire, United Kingdom, PO12 1BS Company number: 09604785 working in partnership with Happy clients The Love Your Pub group has been a pleasure to work with, they truly understand the local element of a business and execute this so well. The marketing campaigns, photography and videos tutorials of the venues, are of such high quality and are to a consistent standard (you would expect to spend a fortune to receive the end product you’re left with). Great first year working with LYPG and we will continue the partnership moving forward! Karl Bradford Prospect Account Manager Molson Coors From the minute I met Dave and he introduced me to his business love your pub I knew I was in great hands. Straight away the reach to the public had a positive impact. If ever I had an issue in any area of my business that I wanted some advice or just to chat through Dave was the person I would instantly turn to. Promoting my business and even providing the most amazing photos of our food and venue are no longer a worry as love your pub look after this for me. The love your pub group offer outstanding value for all the work they have done with my business. Thank you Dave for all the support. Simon Smith Managing Director Skylark Golf & Country Club Love Your Pub has been very helpful for us as a new business just starting out, providing us with extra support and helping us to get our brand and name out there. Personally I love the design of the website as its very easy to search for bars and see the main features of each venue. Dave is always there for any advice and new ideas always keeping in contact and prompting me to publish and advertise more which I find a “Godsend” as I sometimes find myself consumed in other tasks. The company have also taken some fantastic photos of our bar and dishes for the menus. We are very glad to be part of The Love Your Pub Group” Danny O’Brien Owner The Grapes “Working with Love Your Pub has proved to be an effective collaboration for Booker at a regional level. It enables us as a business to provide a solution to our clients in the world of marketing that we didn’t have before. We have a solid relationship now with The Love Your Pub team & look forward to continuing that relationship moving forward.” Martin Bigwood Catering Development Manager Booker Portsmouth “The Love Your Pub Group gives us the opportunity to get the word out about what’s going on within our Pub the way we want to. Love Your Pub can communicate about what’s happening in REAL time within our kitchens to a wider audience specifically in the city that we trade in which in turn enables customers to come visit us and try something new and exciting from our menus. Its been fantastic to have bookings as a result of The Love Your Pub Group particularly over the Christmas period.” Jack Preston, Patisserie Owner , Sweet Science Patisserie “The Love Your Pub Group’ is a fantastic way for people to find a place that is exactly right for their needs. Whether its Cask Ale or a dog friendly pub you are looking for, ‘The Love Your Pub Group’ will give you the best results from the local area.  Since joining with ‘The Love Your Pub Group’ we have been able to utilise their range throughout, including social media and the main website to reach out more especially to those looking for what we are offering in REAL time. A cracking idea!” Matt Chapman, The Marmion Bar & Kitchen Facebook Vimeo Instagram Love Your Pub is a multi service hospitality platform which includes a social media agency, pub recruitment channel, guide and much more. Listing your pub with Love your pub on the guide and taking advantage of our social media management service will boost your visibility as Love Your Pub is the biggest online hospitality guide there is. About Us | Pub Dog Colorado Home Menu About Us Gift Cards & Loyalty Events Rules/FAQs Careers Shop ORDER TAKEOUT Follow Follow Follow ABOUT US PUB DOG CORE VALUES Dogs & Fun Safety & Cleanliness Community & Family OUR STORY The idea of Pub Dog began on a trip to Europe in 2013. Tara and her mom were out to dinner at a fairly nice restaurant and about an hour into the dinner, the most beautiful Newfoundland came out from underneath the table next to them. They were shocked that this beautiful dog had been allowed in the restaurant. Tara came home from the trip and told her dad, who had always been business minded, about this experience and they both questioned why they couldn’t do something like this in the States. She spent months researching and found that allowing dogs in restaurants didn’t really exist anywhere and thus, Pub Dog was born. Tara and her dad spent 3 1/2 years working through the health department, the city, the county, the state and financing before being able to break ground in the fall of 2016. Pub Dog opened its doors in April of 2017. Since then, the building and experience has become a destination that people travel from all over the country to visit! OUR TEAM TARA - Owner Tara was born and raised here in the Pikes Peak region. After going through school to become an engineer, she quickly learned that she wasn’t cut out for that type of work. She then spent 12 years working in a local restaurant before embarking on opening Pub Dog. When she isn’t working, Tara can be found spending time with her pup, Riley, watching sports, going to concerts, traveling with her fiance and being an auntie to her favorite kiddos in the world. CHEYENNE - General Manager Hi Pub Dog Pack! I’m Cheyenne, the proud heart behind Pub Dog Colorado. My journey began in the veterinary and animal shelter world, where I spent years caring for our furry friends and advocating for their well-being. That deep love for animals naturally led me to be a part of a space where dogs and their humans could come together, relax, and enjoy life’s simple pleasures. Alongside my passion for animals, I’ve been pouring drinks and sharing smiles behind the bar for over half my life. Bartending isn’t just a job for me, it’s a way to connect, celebrate community, and craft memorable experiences. At Pub Dog Colorado, I get to blend my love for hospitality with my devotion to dogs, creating a welcoming haven for everyone who walks through our doors. When I’m not at the pub, you’ll find me exploring the breathtaking Colorado mountains with my dogs by my side or tending to my ever-growing collection of plants. These moments recharge me and inspire the warm, vibrant atmosphere we cherish here at Pub Dog. Thanks for stopping by and can’t wait to meet you and your furry companions soon! BRITTANY - Assistant General Manager Hi friends! I’m Brittany — the Assistant General Manager here at Pub Dog Colorado. My journey in hospitality began 16 years ago, driven by a love for creating spaces where people (and pups!) feel at home. From bartending in fast-paced venues to planning unforgettable events, I’ve always thrived in roles where connection, creativity, and community come first. When I joined Pub Dog, it felt like the perfect fit and a place where my passion for great service and my love for dogs could finally collide I started behind the bar shaking cocktails and planning themed nights, and quickly found myself diving headfirst into all things Pub Dog from helping grow our event calendar, to collaborating on new drinks and menu ideas. I thrive on creating an atmosphere where people feel welcome, pups feel safe, and everyone’s having a genuinely great time. When I’m not at the pub, you’ll find me exploring Colorado with my two dogs, Leyah and Pongo, paddleboarding, road tripping, or checking out new food spots around town. They’re my adventure buddies and constant reminder of why a place like Pub Dog matters so much. I can’t wait to make you and your pups day a little better!
